dublin_core.dcvalue: Population aging looms over countries all over the world The social and economic implications of this phenomenon extend beyond the individual person and the immediate family affecting broader society and the global community in profound ways Aging populations increase pressure on already over burdened public health care services and expenditures To address this impending predicament many health care providers and countries have turned to technological solutions The near ubiquity of mobile devices entails that mHealth will rapidly become a key component of technologically enabled health care delivery services This poster presents research and engineering challenges for a sustainable ICT solution that supports information exchange for mobile geriatric care
Studies in health technology and informatics
Actualizing a mobile integrated system for geriatric care.
